name: src/layer.mjs
config
description: The configuration object of this layer.

params.name: horizontalSpeed
params.description: The horizontal speed of the layer.

params.name: verticalSpeed
params.description: The vertical speed of the layer.

params.name: plane
params.description: The plane this parallax layer will occupy.

params.name: backgrounds
params.description: An array of instances that will serve as the background. These are automatically toggled to repeat.

params.name: instances
params.description: A set of instances currently on the layer.

name: updateConfigSpeed
description: Updates the configuration speed of the layer.

unknown.tagValue: {number} pConfig.horizontalSpeed - The horizontal speed of the layer.
{number} pConfig.verticalSpeed - The vertical speed of the layer.

params.name: pConfig
params.description: The speed configuration of the parallax layer.

params.name: pUpdateLayerConfigOnly
params.description: If only to update the layer config and not the instance config.

name: updateHorizontalSpeed
description: Updates the horizontal speed of this layer.

params.name: pHorizontalSpeed
params.description: The new horizontal speed.

params.name: pUpdateLayerConfigOnly
params.description: If only to update the layer config and not the instance config.

name: updateVerticalSpeed
description: Updates the vertical speed of the layer.

params.name: pVerticalSpeed
params.description: The new vertical speed.

params.name: pUpdateLayerConfigOnly
params.description: If only to update the layer config and not the instance config.

name: add
description:
Adds the instance to the parallax layer.
When using this API the instance should already be on the map.
The instance's 'plane' will be changed to match the plane of the layer.

unknown.tagValue: {number} pConfig.x - The horizontal speed of this instance. (This will be ignored and the layer's speed will be used.)
{number} pConfig.y - The vertical speed of this instance. (This will be ignored and the layer's speed will be used.)
{boolean} pConfig.infiniteHorizontal - Whether this instance will be treated as a horizontal background and loop seamlessly.
{boolean} pConfig.infiniteVertical - Whether this instance will be treated as a vertical background and loop seamlessly.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to add to the layer.

params.name: pConfig
params.description: The personal config of this instance. Akin to the parallax info passed via the `Parallax.add` API.

name: remove
description: Removes the instance from the parallax layer.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to remove from the layer.

name: src/parallax.mjs
version
description: The version of the module.

name: logger
description: The logger module this module uses to log errors / logs

name: Layer
description: The layer class.

name: instances
description: An set of instances that use the parallax system.

name: instanceWeakMap
description: Weakmap to store info on instances used in this module.

name: lastCamPos
description: The last position of the camera.

name: anchorPos
description: The virtual position on the map where the layers look natural together.

name: getCamPos
description: Gets the camera position.

unknown.tagValue: {{x: number, y: number}} - The camera position.

name: setAnchor
description: Sets the anchor position for the parallax system.

params.name: pAnchor
params.description: The virtual position on the map where the layers look natural together.

name: setAnchorX
description: Sets the anchor x position for the parallax system.

params.name: pX
params.description: The x position to set the anchor to.

name: setAnchorY
description: Sets the anchor y position for the parallax system.

params.name: pY
params.description: The y position to set the anchor to.

name: createLoopInstances
description: Creates two clones of the instance to loop infinitely.

unknown.tagValue: {Diob[]} - An array of the two clones.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to base the clones off of.

params.name: pBypassEvent
params.description: Whether to bypass the onRelocated event.

return.description: An array of the two clones.

name: toggleInfiniteHorizontal
description: Enables infinite looping for the horizontal plane.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to loop.

params.name: pBypassEvent
params.description: Whether to bypass the onRelocated event.

name: toggleInfiniteVertical
description: Enables infinite looping for the vertical plane.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to loop.

params.name: pBypassEvent
params.description: Whether to bypass the onRelocated event.

name: toggleInfinitePlanes
description: Toggle infinite looping for both the horizontal and vertical planes.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to loop.

name: add
description:
Adds an instance to the parallax system.
Call this first and then add your instance to the map.

unknown.tagValue: {number} pParallaxConfig.x - The x multiplier for this instance. Controls how fast or slow this instance moves. -Infinity to Infinity. 1 to move with camera.
{number} pParallaxConfig.y - The y multiplier for this instance. Controls how fast or slow this instance moves. -Infinity to Infinity. 1 to move with camera.
{boolean} pParallaxConfig.infiniteHorizontal - Whether this instance will infiniteHorizontal endlessly.
{boolean} pParallaxConfig.infiniteVertical - Whether this instance will infiniteVertical endlessly.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to add to the parallax system.

params.name: pParallaxConfig
params.description: The parallax info that tells this module how to control this instance.

params.name: pX
params.description: The x position this instance will start at.

params.name: pY
params.description: The y position this instance will start at.

params.name: pMap
params.description:
The map this instance will start at.

## The following is how the speed of the parallax multipliers are factored in.  
(x | y) < 1 = faster behind the camera eg: (-> Player goes this way = Instance goes this way <-)  
(x | y) > 1 faster against the camera eg: (-> Player goes this way = Instance goes this way ->)  
(x | y) = 0 = static to the camera eg: (-> Player goes this way = Instance does nothing, and moves with the camera)   
(x | y) = 1 = moves with the camera eg: (-> Player goes this way = Instance goes this way -> at position of camera)

name: init
description: Initializes this instance.

unknown.tagValue: {number} pParallaxConfig.x - The x multiplier for this instance. Controls how fast or slow this instance moves. -Infinity to Infinity. 0 to move with camera.
{number} pParallaxConfig.y - The y multiplier for this instance. Controls how fast or slow this instance moves. -Infinity to Infinity. 0 to move with camera.
{boolean} pParallaxConfig.infiniteHorizontal - Whether this instance will loop endlessly.
{boolean} pParallaxConfig.infiniteVertical - Whether this instance will loop endlessly.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to initialize.

params.name: pParallaxConfig
params.description: The parallax info that tells this module how to control this instance.

name: remove
description: Removes an instance to the parallax system.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to remove to the parallax system.

name: update
description: Updates the parallax system.

params.name: pCameraX
params.description: The x position of the camera.

params.name: pCameraY
params.description: The y position of the camera.

name: updateInstance
description: Updates the instance's position based on the camera's position.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to update.

params.name: pCameraX
params.description: The x position of the camera.

params.name: pCameraY
params.description: The y position of the camera.

params.name: pAnchorX
params.description: The x position of the anchor.

params.name: pAnchorY
params.description: The y position of the anchor.

name: handleOnRelocated
description: Handles the onRelocated event for instances. Moves their children in relativity to their position.

params.name: pInstance
params.description: The instance to handle the event for.

params.name: pChildren
params.description: An array of children belonging to the instance.

content:
# Parallax Module 
A parallax module that will enable effortless integration of depth effects into your game.

## Installation

### ES Module

```js
import { Parallax } from './parallax.mjs';
```

### IIFE (Immediately Invoked Function Expression)

```js
<script src="parallax.js"></script>;
// ...
window.ParallaxBundle.Parallax;
```

### Global Dependency

Parallax relies on the `VYLO` variable being globally accessible.
name: ./README.md
